#summary List of projects that use BridJ

Please keep in mind that [CreditsAndLicense BridJ is licensed under the BSD license], so anyone using it must state it in his documentation and/or other distributed materials (but there's no need to publish any modified sources, although it is good practice ;-)).

Here are some of the projects known to use BridJ internally.
  * [https://github.com/atsushieno/falplayer-android-j falplayer-android-j] : [https://github.com/atsushieno Atsushi Eno]'s experimental Java port of [https://github.com/atsushieno/falplayer-android falplayer], a "repeatable OGG Vorbis player for Android"
  * [http://code.google.com/p/javacl/ JavaCL] : OpenCL bindings for Java (JavaCL uses JNA by default but has a BridJ port available as the javacl-bridj Maven artifact)
  * [http://code.google.com/p/scalacl/ ScalaCL] : optimizing Scala compiler plugin + GPU-backed collections (using OpenCL)
